title: About JAB Lab
text: JAB Lab (Joe’s Astoundingly Broke Lab) uses modern technology to amplify the creation of research tools and execution of small-scale research. We embrace a learning-while-doing approach: systematic curation and synthesis paired with flexibility in execution.

title: About JAB Lab
text: JAB Lab (Joe’s Astoundingly Broke Lab) uses modern technology to amplify the creation of research tools and execution of small-scale research. We embrace a learning-while-doing approach: systematic curation and synthesis paired with flexibility in execution.

title: About JAB Lab
text:
Research Philosophy
Independent research doesn’t require institutional affiliation to be rigorous. By combining: - Modern computational tools (LLMs, Python/R, Quarto) - Systematic evidence synthesis - Iterative tool development - Open science practices
…we can tackle sophisticated questions about cognition, social behavior, and research practice itself.

title: About JAB Lab
text:
Current Focus Areas

Violence Research
Multi-level evidence synthesis examining individual, relational, community, and societal factors. Building toward model cards and real-time event pattern detection.


AI & Scholarship
Investigating hallucitated citations in academic work - when do they occur, who detects them, what contexts enable them? Pilot study in progress with GPTZero.


Evaluation Methods
Comparing frameworks across educational and AI evaluation. Where do best practices converge? How do validity, replicability, and accessibility differ across domains?


Intellectual Network Map
Interactive visualization mapping personal reading collection across 8 core intellectual problem domains. Reveals conceptual connections, identifies knowledge gaps, and highlights bridge authors who span multiple fields. Built with Python/NetworkX and deployed as an interactive web application.


Research Tools
Developing platforms for literature curation, citation management, knowledge synthesis, and conceptual mapping. Making research infrastructure accessible.

title: About JAB Lab
text:
Principal Investigator
Joseph Zachary (JZ) Stafura, PhD
Cognitive psychologist combining rigorous experimental methods with modern data science and computational tools. Current work focuses on evidence synthesis, research infrastructure development, and AI-assisted scholarship analysis.
Education: - PhD, Cognitive Psychology (Cognitive Neuroscience concentration)
- BA, Psychology & English Literature, Purchase College (Summa Cum Laude)
Current Work: - Built interactive evidence synthesis dashboard for violence research (deployed) - Developing LLM-assisted tools for literature curation and citation management - Pilot study on hallucitated citations in scholarly work (with GPTZero) - Comparative framework analysis across educational and AI evaluation domains
Technical Expertise:
Statistical & Computational Methods - Advanced modeling: GLM, mixed models, SEM, psychometrics - Programming: R, Python, SQL - Reproducible workflows: Quarto, Git/GitHub, literate programming - Experimental design and psychometric validation
Research Infrastructure & Tools - LLM-assisted evidence synthesis and knowledge curation - Interactive dashboard development (HTML/CSS/JavaScript) - Citation management and bibliographic analysis - Web-based research tools and data visualization
Background & Context - Founded SMS-based assessment platform for team performance and individual development - Extensive EEG/ERP work: event-related potential studies, factor analysis (PCA), wavelet analysis, laboratory setup and validation - Ecological Momentary Assessment research (University of Pittsburgh) - Published work in language processing, memory, and cognitive neuroscience
Google Scholar | LinkedIn | GitHub

title: About JAB Lab
text:
Why “JAB Lab”?
The tongue-in-cheek name reflects the reality: this is self-funded, informal, and built on the belief that doing creative, rigorous research attracts meaningful collaboration and opportunities.

title: About JAB Lab
text:

title: Joe’s Astoundingly Broke (JAB) Lab
text:
Welcome
JAB Lab uses modern technology to amplify the creation of research tools and the execution of small-scale research. We take a learning-while-doing approach that ensures content knowledge development through systematic curation and synthesis, as well as flexibility in execution.

title: Joe’s Astoundingly Broke (JAB) Lab
text:
Research Interests
Current work explores cognitive and social processes through evidence synthesis, computational methods, and tool development:

Violence research: Multi-level evidence synthesis across individual, relational, community, and societal factors
AI evaluation: Examining hallucinated citations in scholarly work; comparing evaluation frameworks in education vs. AI domains
Research tools: Building platforms for literature curation, citation management, and knowledge synthesis
Intellectual mapping: Systematizing conceptual relationships across domains
Ecological cognition: Understanding socio-cognitive processes in naturalistic contexts

title: Joe’s Astoundingly Broke (JAB) Lab
text:
About
I’m a cognitive psychologist with expertise in experimental design, statistical modeling, and data science. My research combines rigorous methodology with practical tool-building, using LLMs and modern data science to tackle questions about human cognition, social dynamics, and research practice itself.
Background: - PhD in Cognitive Psychology (Cognitive Neuroscience concentration) - BA in Psychology and English Literature, Purchase College (Summa Cum Laude) - EMA research experience (Saul Shiffman’s lab, University of Pittsburgh) - Founded digital platform company using SMS-based assessment for team performance and individual development
Methods & Tools:
Statistical & Computational - GLM tradition, mixed models, psychometrics, SEM - R, Python, SQL - Quarto for reproducible research - Git/GitHub for version control
Research Infrastructure - LLM-assisted literature synthesis and curation - Citation management and knowledge graphs - Interactive dashboards and visualization - Web-based research tools
Data Collection - Ecological Momentary Assessment (EMA) - Experimental design - Text-based and mobile platforms

title: Joe’s Astoundingly Broke (JAB) Lab
text:
Current Work
Violence Research - Interactive evidence synthesis dashboard exploring ecological levels of violence, with plans for model card development and real-time event tracking
Hallucitation Study - Pilot investigation of domain and expertise factors in AI-generated citation hallucinations (with GPTZero)
Evaluation Methods - Comparative analysis of frameworks and best practices across educational and AI evaluation domains
Intellectual Network Map - Interactive visualization mapping 450+ books across 8 intellectual problem domains, revealing connections and knowledge gaps

title: Code & Tools
text:
Research tools and utilities developed for evidence synthesis, literature curation, and computational analysis. Built with modern data science and reproducible workflows.
All code available on GitHub.

title: Code & Tools
text:
Research tools and utilities developed for evidence synthesis, literature curation, and computational analysis. Built with modern data science and reproducible workflows.
All code available on GitHub.

title: Code & Tools
text:
Research Infrastructure

Evidence Synthesis Dashboards
Interactive web-based tools for systematic literature curation and knowledge synthesis.
Featured: Violence Research Dashboard - Multi-level ecological evidence browser with citation management
Technologies: HTML/CSS/JavaScript, JSON data structures, interactive filtering
Status: Active - Violence dashboard deployed



LLM-Assisted Research Tools
Utilities for literature synthesis, citation extraction, and knowledge graph construction using large language models.
Applications: Automated citation parsing, theoretical framework extraction, model card generation
Technologies: Python, Claude API, prompt engineering, structured output parsing
Status: In development



Citation & Reference Management
Tools for managing research literature, detecting hallucitated citations, and maintaining bibliographic databases.
Technologies: Python, BibTeX, JSON schemas, text analysis
Status: Active - Hallucitation detection pilot

title: Code & Tools
text:
Analysis & Visualization

Statistical Modeling
Reusable functions for mixed models, psychometric analysis, SEM, and longitudinal data.
Technologies: R (lme4, lavaan, psych), Python (statsmodels, scikit-learn)
Status: In development



Interactive Dashboards
Custom visualization and reporting tools for research communication.
Technologies: R (ggplot2, plotly), Python (matplotlib, seaborn), Quarto, HTML/CSS
Featured: Violence Research Dashboard, Intellectual Network Map - Network visualization of 450+ books across intellectual domains
Status: Active



Reproducible Workflows
Quarto-based analysis pipelines for transparent, version-controlled research.
Technologies: Quarto, R Markdown, Jupyter, Git/GitHub
Status: Active - Lab website built with Quarto

title: Code & Tools
text:
Data Collection (Legacy)

Ecological Momentary Assessment
Tools for EMA and text-based data collection from previous work.
Technologies: Python, R, SMS APIs, mobile platforms
Status: Archived - Available for reference

title: Projects
text:
Interactive evidence synthesis exploring ecological levels of violence Methods: Ecological Momentary Assessment, longitudinal modeling, risk assessment validation
Status: Active - Data collection and analysis ongoing
View project details




Examining domain and expertise factors underlying AI-generated citation hallucinations in scholarly and professional writing. Investigating when and why hallucinated citations (“hallucitations”) appear in submitted and published texts.
Methods: Text analysis, citation verification, domain expertise assessment, LLM-assisted detection
Status: Pilot study - In progress with resource assistance from GPTZero
View project details




Developing and validating assessment tools for individual and team performance. Emphasis on ecologically valid measurement in applied settings.
Methods: EMA, text-based data collection, psychometric validation, team network analysis
Status: Active - Tool development and field testing
View project details




Interactive visualization of 450+ books organized by core intellectual problems rather than academic disciplines. Maps connections between 8 fundamental domains (Consciousness, Language, Violence, Social Structure, Aesthetic Experience, Self/Subject, Temporality, Place/Space), identifies knowledge gaps, and highlights bridge authors who span multiple fields.
Methods: Network analysis, Python/NetworkX, Plotly visualization, Wikipedia API integration, conceptual mapping
Status: Active - Live visualization deployed with interactive features
View live project | GitHub
